title: Programme proposed to be implemented by the Department of Export Agriculture to meet the export agricultural crop production targets
decision_details: - The Department of Export Agriculture carries out the necessary development and research activities for the promotion of 14 export agricultural crops namely pepper, coffee, areca nut, cocoa, cloves, nutmeg, cardamom, vanilla, betel, lemon grass, citrus, garcinia, turmeric and ginger. Currently, these crops are spread over an area of ​​about 82,000 hectares, and approximately one million stakeholders are engaged in cultivation and industries related to export agricultural crops. The proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation to implement the following programmes by the Department of Export Agriculture to encourage and promote stakeholders from the year 2025 and to provide Government benefits up to a maximum of 50% of the investment made by farmers and other stakeholders under the said programmes, was approved by the Cabinet:* Export Crops Area Expansion Programme* Programme to Increase the Productivity of Export Crops* Organic Export Crops Promotion Programme* Activities related to organic cultivation certification and laboratory analysis* International Fair Trade System Certification* Internationally recognized certifications applicable to organic farming* Facilitating the Post-harvest technology Programme* Nursery Development Programme* Maintaining export agricultural crop cultivation demonstration plots* Export agricultural crop projects related to the tourism industry
